content:
Diagnosis:
T2N0 cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma right temple

Previous treatment:
Wide local excision March 2024 - clear margins achieved
Post-operative radiotherapy 50Gy in 20 fractions completed May 2024

Current situation:
Review following completion of radiotherapy

Examination findings:
Healed surgical scar right temple with expected post-radiation changes. No evidence of recurrence. No palpable cervical lymphadenopathy.

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of adjuvant radiotherapy to the right temple. The acute radiation effects have now largely settled with only mild skin dryness remaining. The surgical site has healed well with an excellent cosmetic result. He reports no new symptoms or concerns.

The plan is for clinical surveillance with 3-monthly reviews for the first year. I have provided written information about sun protection and skin care. We will arrange baseline CT imaging at 3 months post-treatment completion. [redacted name] understands to contact us if any new concerns develop in the meantime.

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision with clear margins
Healed surgical scar with expected post-radiation changes, no evidence of recurrence

patient_facts.value: Healed surgical scar right temple with expected post-radiation changes. No evidence of recurrence. No palpable cervical lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: T2N0 cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of right temple treated with surgery and radiotherapy. Good recovery with no evidence of recurrence
Baseline CT imaging at 3 months post-treatment completion
Clinical surveillance with 3-monthly reviews for the first year
